pros: Tight knit community and close friendships. Amazing area with lots of opportunities in and out of college. Smaller campus with a lot of close connections in the area. Quality education and you get to know your professors.
cons: Not as "flashy" as some state universities, but they do have several new building plans in the works.

pros: working with and developing adults
cons: restrictions based on cultural beliefs

pros:
Family environment 
Small community

pros: Small community, Christian environment. Lunch discount
cons: Poor financial planning, stifled expression.

review_title: Great people and time off, but lack of financial stability and involved leadership.
pros: Generous paid time off, technology upgrades, tuition reimbursement after 5 years, cafeteria food quality/cost, access to fitness center, incredibly friendly & caring community, beautiful landscaping, opportunity to make a difference in student's lives.
cons: Financial stability, no cost of living wage increase in years, no retirement investment matching, nepotism, lack of budget prioritization, lack of communication between staff and faculty, lack of necessary staff resources results in overworked employees, outdated buildings.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Olathe, KS
pros: Working at MidAmerica Nazarene University offers flexible hours and friendly co-workers and managers. I enjoy being able to work with students on furthering their educations. The facilities are nice and comfortable to work in.
cons: Since I work part-time, I'm not eligible for benefits and the pay can be a little low. The hours are fine but can be a little spread out and sometimes you can work an unpredictable schedule.

review_title: It all depends on what department you work in
pros:
Good PTO, holiday pay, and insurance benefits. 
There is a handful of genuine and kind people that work there.
Good pay for faculty.
cons:
Very poor communication from faculty to staff- what was said in faculty assembly would be completely different from what was said in staff assembly (only two days apart). 
No room to advance.
Lack of communication between departments.
Select faculty are very difficult to work with.
The staff is undervalued- poor pay and disregarded by faculty. You're never quite sure if you'll have a job in the next semester.

review_title: Great Place To Work If You're a Student
pros: If you love babies or kids & have love for God overall then this is the place to work at. Complimentary fresh bakery such as donuts & Keurig Coffee every Sunday morning. Training is hands on doesn't take long neither is it rocket science when it comes to changing diapers. The environment is super friendly. Great job for a college student who needs the flexible hours.
cons: We need more staff availability for Sunday mornings in Nursery.

pros: A true opportunity to work with and develop young individuals as they're going through a transitional period of their life. Minimal office hours and flexible schedule.
cons: On call 24 hours a day. Responding to fire alarms or emergencies in the middle of the night.

pros: Great place for work/life balance, spiritual and professional development activities.  Lots of PTO and vacation time plus flex-time is offered in my department.
cons: Recently a freeze on salaries, processes/relationships between departments aren't great.

review_title: MNU is a great place to be but struggles with issues
pros: students are the best incentive
cons: Administration seen as if they are in charge with out any help from faculty

pros: Strong sense of community connection to the city of Olathe. Amazing support to the under graduate student population.
cons: No raises provided over 7 year period. Non-congruency between under grad and professional & graduate programs.

review_title: Working as a Student Tutor at MNU
pros: Great co-workers and managers, easygoing atmosphere most of the time.
cons: Nothing major, but an increase in wages would be good--$8.50 is pretty low for a tutor
